question_title: What will be the value of "Nominal Broad U.S. Dollar Index" on 2026-02-10?
summary: Short-horizon forecast for the Nominal Broad U.S. Dollar Index (DTWEXBGS) on Feb 10, 2026. Last known value was 119.2855 on Jan 23. Based on historical daily volatility (~0.295% daily std), recent downward trend, and news about January dollar weakness partially offset by a Feb 1 bounce following the Warsh Fed nomination, I estimate a median around 119.0 with moderate uncertainty. Applied 1.4x widening factor for tail risks and the 7-day data gap since last observation.

factors.description: Historical volatility model: 0.295% daily std scaled to 12 trading days gives base uncertainty of ~1 point
Recent downward trend: Index fell from 119.83 to 119.29 over Jan 20-23 (~0.027/day decline)
January weakness: Dollar had worst month since June, falling ~2% on 'sell America' trade
Warsh nomination bounce: Dollar rose ~1% on Feb 1 after hawkish Fed chair pick announced
Data gap uncertainty: 7 trading days between last observation (Jan 23) and today adds estimation error
